Reviews.Title: “WTF”
Reviews.Author: Harold J
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my GF for the night while visiting LA, we checked in and the manager said he would have our room ready in 15 minutes which was very strange my girlfriend had to use the rest room so the manager gave us the key to the room we entered to find a used condom laying in the garbage the room was totally destroyed like someone had od'd after a drugged out fantasy this was only the start of our night, we left for 1 hour to give him more then ENOUGH time to clean the room. we came back and only the sheets were changed we could hear the people next door have a conversation and romance noises....., I took off my shoes to rest my feet and to my surprise me feet were sticking to the ground I was puzzled I paid $72 to stay at a Law & Order SVU rape scene I tried hard to go to sleep but the TV would come back on and off with porn hardcore interracial porn where it looked like the woman was suffering I don't think It was legal to be shown in the US. I woke up the next morning to find that the sheets did not match the mattress so that I was actually laying on the mattress itself and that there was a white crusty area on it....., I went to take a shower and the water was only HOT no cold or luke warm straight hot the towel I was provided had black smudges on it and the window was cracked and broken making easy access to the room. The manager was nice and all but that motel is a portal to hell I do not recommend anyone to stay there except junkies, homeless and prostitute's

Reviews.Title: “Use to come all the time but every room has bed bugs now not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: jay00000
Reviews.Content: Use to come all the time but every room has bed bugs now not worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Helladise Inn & Suites”
Reviews.Author: VagrantSoul
Reviews.Content: Ok, let me start from the beginning. I arrive 15 minutes late to my 1pm reservation. So why then did I have to wait 30 minutes for them to clean my room? And by clean I mean, wipe things down/off, and run the vac twice down the middle of the room. then I was able to walk in. Closing the front door to the room, was a task. Closing the bathroom door, was a mission. Since I'm on the hellish mission impossible bathroom...the room was so small I had to leave it to change my mind. The deathtrap of a shower had at best warm water. I had to leave it run for 30 minutes for hot. But once it was hot, it was hot! The window in the bathroom looked like one of those movie windows that a criminal staying over night would try to escape from. Which would have been easy since there was no screen on it. The bed was a king, but the headboard was a cal-king. which means it wasn't even attached to the bed! The sheets had burn stains on them, and there was no fitted bottom sheet. The Direct tv, had issues all night!. Every channel I tried to watch had static. The nicest touch to the room was the loveseat. And since the headboard wasn't attached you know the loveseat got over worked! Sadly, with all of that in the room, you barely had room for a table. Or at least THEY did. Not to mention that the fridge didn't work, and ice (which in most places is free) was 50 cents. And where was I gonna put on this soon to be water?!! Overall - if it weren't for the company, I would've packed up, cussed the guy in the front for having the nerve to call this place paradise anything, and left. Had I known there was a Rodeway Inn 5 minutes away, I would have gone there. Please don't make my mistake!

Reviews.Title: “We Were Eaten By Bed Bugs Stay Away!!!”
Reviews.Author: somamodel
Reviews.Content: This is the dirtiest place I have ever stayed ..................I have been all over the world , and never saw such a room it was the first lower left room for disabled.102 I think We were very tired from being at the beach . When I first got in the bed I noticed a sting. I fell asleep in the morning I noticed some itching. Later that day I had swelling bumps all over my body from head to toe. Later that night they became infected over 100 Bed bug bites. We have contacted the health department of Las Angeles , I hope they close this place then bull doze it. If you want to stay here bring the local exterminator with you. Ken and Kate Keisler San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, quiet, funky--and everything worked.”
Reviews.Author: JackClark
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this little motel are decorated in 1950s-60s eclectic funk. It looks a bit doubtful from the outside, and the room did not impress me when I first opened the door either. But I stayed here five nights and found it clean, comfortable, and quiet, with a good shower with plenty of hot water. Also, everything worked, including the wifi, TV, refrigerator, microwave, iron, drawers, and locks. The service is good and the management is friendly and helpful. Judging from the parking lot containing a large, black mercedes sedan and many expensive SUVs, quiet a few people who probably could afford a better looking place stayed here. My five-year-old Subaru was the oldest car in the lot. If you don't mind kind of funky, mish-mash decor, this motel should do you well. If a really nice location is a must, you'll probably want to look elsewhere. This motel is located south of Santa Monica in not the finest L.A. territory. But it's only about a one-minute drive to the I-405.

Reviews.Title: “Ok nothing special”
Reviews.Author: AndyAA
Reviews.Content: Needed somewhere to stay between LAX and Venice Beach and this probably wasnt the best choice location wise as there isn't much around. Host was nice enough but stuggled to pick up my Australian accent. Room was pretty dark, floors were average and my bathroom window was very flimsy. Overall ok stay but I would recommend looking elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Horrible & Dirty”
Reviews.Author: lina4787
Reviews.Content: our room was dirty, the floors were sticky, there were dirty panties from a previous vistors which shows how much they care and make sure their rooms are clean. towels were dirty and could not get any new ones until the next morning. horrible customer service by the manager. i would not recommend this motel to anyone who likes clean rooms and good customer service which we deserve if we are paying customers. They also had some druggies rooming there to. i had some drunk guy invite me to his room and it was only 7 PM i had to call my husband to go outside with me. I would just imagine if it was after hours and i was alone. Not for families are girls getaway. Horrible stay

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: pumarocks
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for at this "Inn." The dresser was missing drawers, the television remote did not work, the floors were "sticky", the coffee table unclean, and the hotwater was hit or miss. Also, there were some "hourly" customers. Not a family place. However, If you are staying in LA with some friends it is probably not that bad. it is close to the Culver City shuttle that will take you all the way to Venice Beach. Also, the coffee shop 'Rumor Mill' across the street is not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “The Paradise Hotel - NOT a family resort!”
Reviews.Author: AlohaIdaho
Reviews.Content: The Paradise Hotel is located in a quite neighborhood, and outside appears a charming motor-hotel complex, with parking right outside your door. The manager lives on site. We stayed a week, and had these problems: The microwave was half broken, at time firing and popping like it might explode. Also, the hot water leaves ALOT to be desired, so showers must be quick. Also, there is free wireless internet, but the cable only has a few channels. To name a few, CNN, FOX, basic channels, HBO and also a dedicated porn channel. I MEAN dedicated, as in non stop porno's 24 hours a day. At first we thought it was some kind of mistake or joke, but i guess not. It's quite strange...in fact, this may very well be the strangest hotel I've ever stayed in. At $325 a week ($60 a night) for a king-size room with a microwave and mini-fridge, it is moderatly priced for the city, but could offer a little more for the money, I think, as I've stayed at dozens of hotels for 45-55 a night and got a higher level of quality. However, like alot of weekly stay hotels, it's not filled with bums or druggies, and is quiet, so if your a drifter with a little cash in hand, this is a pretty good bet. Especially if you have a liking towards XXX-rated flicks!

HotelInfo.Name: Paradise Inn & Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 11750 Washington Boulevard, Los Angeles, CA 90066
